meta.source: ChrisK3's Star Citizen Reference Sheets - Wikelo Section
meta.note: Auto-extracted, may need manual corrections via the admin editor

items.name: Tripledown "Heatwave" Pistol
items.recipe: 20x Carinite (Ore); 20x Bluemoon Fungus; 1x Tripledown Pistol
items.description: Wikelo offers a skin for the Tripledown Pistol named the Heatwave.
items.sources: Carinite @ Align & Mine Ore; Bluemoon Fungus @ Lootable in rocky caves; Tripledown Pistol @ Sold in Levski Link
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it. I suggest pairing Hunter/Desert with Stoneskin Agra Undersuit, Cobalt/Navy with TCS-4 Undersuit Twilight, Jungle/Tree with TCS-4 Undersuit

items.name: Strata
items.recipe: 30x Carinite (Ore); 4x RCMBNT-PWL-1; 4x RCMBNT-PWL-2; 4x RCMBNT-PWL-3; 1x Strata Arms; 1x Strata Legs; 1x Strata Helmet; 1x Strata Backpack; 1x Strata Core
items.description: Wikelo offers a skin for the Strata Armor set named Heatwave in 4.6
items.sources: Carinite @ Align & Mine Ore; RCMBNT-PWL-1, 2 & 3 @ Lootable in ASD Onxy Facilities; Strata "Vanilla" Armor Set @ Sold in Levski Cargo Shop Link
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

items.name: Testudo Set Clanguard
items.recipe: 15x Vanduul Plating; 15x Vanduul Metal; 1x Testudo Helmet Turfwar; 1x Testudo Arms Turfwar; 1x Testudo Legs Turfwar; 1x Testudo Core Turfwar; 1x Testudo Backpack Turfwar
items.reward: Testudo Set Clanguard (Core, Helmet, Arms, Legs, Backpack)
items.description: Wikelo offers a Vanduul skin for the Testudo Set and a skin for the Boomtube with Vanduul metal and plating ziptied to it
items.sources: Vanduul Plating @ Vanduul-Tech Smugglers; Vanduul Metal @ Vanduul-Tech Smugglers; Boomtube Rocket Launcher @ Vanduul-Tech Smugglers; Testudo Set Turfwar @ Vanduul-Tech Smugglers; Large Artifact Fragment (Pristine) @ Blue Boxes at Vanduul-Tech Smugglers, Derelict Outposts, etc
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

items.name: Palatino Mark I
items.recipe: 14x Yormandi Eye; 7x Yormandi Tongue; 1x Palatino Helmet; 1x Palatino Arms; 1x Palatino Legs; 1x Palatino Core; 1x Palatino Backpack
items.description: Wikelo offers a skin for the Palatino Set and F55 with a mostly white, gray and red accented skin with test dummy rondels
items.sources: Yormandi Eye, Tongue @ Yormandi boss fight; Palatino Set Armor @ Orange loot boxes at Hostile Distrobution Centers like Dupree, Greycat Industrial inside and outside.; F55 LMG @ "Juggernaut" NPC enemies, can be encountered most places including DCs, Pyro, Bunkers etc
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

items.name: Geist
items.recipe: 4x ASD Secure Drive; 1x Geist Armor Arms ASD Edition; 1x Geist Armor Core ASD Edition; 1x Geist Armor Helmet ASD Edition; 1x Geist Armor Legs ASD Edition; 1x Geist Armor Backpack ASD Edition
items.description: Wikelo offers a snow camo version of the new Geist light stealth armor and Zenith Laser Sniper in 4.3, Armor price dropped in 4.3.2 to 1x ASD Secure Drive from 10x, thanks Krovax for telling me. Sniper's sign also says 1x but mission is 10x, Issue Concil Report
items.sources: ASD Secure Drive @ Onyx Sites Missions Reward, also a very rare drop on NPCs.; Geist Armor <slot> ASD Edition @ ASD Onyx Sites (orange boxes); Zenith Laser Sniper Rifle @ ASD Onyx Sites (weapon racks)
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

items.name: Bokto Armor Set
items.recipe: 1x Irradiated Valakkar Pearl (Grade AAA); 1x Antium Arms; 1x Antium Legs; 1x Antium Core; 1x Antium Helmet
items.description: Wikelo has a armor set similar to Ana Wao (formerly sold by CIG as part of Downburst) and Ana Endro (traded by Wikelo) but glowing nuclear green. Still offered in 4.3.2 but armor you pay is now Antium instead of Ana Endro.
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

items.name: Ana Armor Endro
items.recipe: 1x Carinite (Pure); Antium Base Set
items.description: Wikelo still offers a version of the Antium/Ana armor in 4.3, and CIG fixed the mission so you hand in base antium armor instead of the end product.
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

items.name: Glowy Armor Set
items.recipe: 1x Irradiated Valakkar Pearl (Grade AAA); Antium Base Set
items.description: Wikelo has a new armor set in 4.2, similar to Ana Wao (formerly sold by CIG as part of Downburst) and Ana Endro (traded by Wikelo) but glowing nuclear green. Still offered in 4.5 but price is different.
items.notes: The armor doesn't have a proper name yet, just a placeholder string. There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

items.name: Corbel "Crush" Set
items.recipe: 10x ASD Secure Drive; 1x Corbel Set Mire (Helmet, Core, Legs, Arms); 1x Novikov Backpack Mire; 5x RCMBNT-RGL-1; 5x RCMBNT-RGL-2; 5x RCMBNT-RGL-3
items.reward: Corbel "Crush" Armor Set (Core, Helmet, Arms, Legs, Backpack)
items.description: Wikelo offers a skin for the Corbel Set that's very shiny and Fresnel Energy LMG in 4.3.1, in 4.5 the gun mission doesn't exist anymore, it's instead rewarded with the Military Wolf L-21
items.sources: ASD Secure Drive @ Onyx Sites Missions Reward, also a very rare drop on NPCs.; Corbel <slot> Mire @ ASD Site-B "Hyperion" (orange boxes); Novikov Backpack Mire @ ASD Site-B "Hyperion" (orange boxes); RCMBNT-(PWL / RGL / XTL) @ ASD Site-B "Hyperion"; Fresnel Energy LMG @ Gunracks of New ASD Site-B "Hyperion"
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it. I suggest pairing Hunter/Desert with Stoneskin Agra Undersuit, Cobalt/Navy with TCS-4 Undersuit Twilight, Jungle/Tree with TCS-4 Undersuit

items.name: DCP Armor Hunter Camo
items.mission_name: Look at desert but don't see you
items.recipe: 1x Wikelo Favour; 3x Ace Interceptor Helmet; 15x Juvenile Valakkar Fangs
items.description: Wikelo got DCP heavy armors from Clark Defense in 4.1.1, the cost has gone up from 1x Ace Interceptor Helmet to 3x, and they fixed the bug where the Hunter helmet was missing. here is what they look like and how to get them.
items.sources: Wikelo Favour @ 1x Wikelo Favour costs 15x Irradiated Apex Valakkar Pearls. (in 4.2) 4.1.1 Favors from scrip should carry over into 4.2, they did between 4.1.1 PTU builds.; Ace Interceptor Helmets @ Looted from killed Ace Pilots in the new Foxwell Patrol Missions / Headhunters Patrol Missions. Don't hard kill the ship, makes pilot vanish.; Juvenile Valakkar Fangs @ Looted from killed Juvenile Valakkar they have 3x each, here is where they can be found: Juvenile Valakkar Habitat.; UNE Unification War Medal (Damaged) @ Looted from Derelict Outpost specifically the Small Grey Boxes. Or larger (150k & 300k) blue boxes at Hathor Group Locations.; Grassland Quasi Grazer Egg @ Looted from killed Grassland Quasi Grazer they have roughly 10 each, here is where they can be found: Grassland Quasi Grazer Habitat. Can also be bought in Pyro.
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it. I suggest pairing Hunter/Desert with Stoneskin Agra Undersuit, Cobalt/Navy with TCS-4 Undersuit Twilight, Jungle/Tree with TCS-4 Undersuit

further_reading.title: Inside Star Citizen | Alpha 4.2: Into the Storm (ISC on Storm Breaker)
Inside Star Citizen on Patrol Missions

items.name: Quartz
items.recipe: 1x Wikelo Favour; 3x Ace Interceptor Helmet; 15x Juvenile Valakkar Fangs; 1x Quartz Energy SMG
items.description: Wikelo has 3 gun skins for Quartz Energy SMG here is what they look like and how to get them. Wikelo's Locations: Dasi Hurston, Kinga microTech, Selo Crusader. Price has gone up in 4.2 from 1x Ace Interceptor Helmet, to 3x.
items.sources: Wikelo Favour @ 1x Wikelo Favour costs 15x Irradiated Valakkar Apex Pearls / 50x Scrip / 50x Carinite (Align & Mine ore); Ace Interceptor Helmets @ Looted from killed Ace Pilots in the new Foxwell Patrol Missions / Headhunters Patrol Missions, Don't hard kill the ship, makes pilot vanish.; Juvenile Valakkar Fangs @ Looted from killed Juvenile Valakkar they have 3x each, here is where they can be found: Juvenile Valakkar Habitat.; UEE 6th Platoon Medal (Damaged) @ Looted from Derelict Outpost specifically the Small Grey Boxes. Or larger (150k & 300k) blue boxes at Hathor Group Locations.; Grassland Quasi Grazer Egg @ Looted from killed Grassland Quasi Grazer they have roughly 12 each, here is where they can be found: Grassland Quasi Grazer Habitat.; Quartz Energy SMG @ Looted from Align & Mine PAF & OLP locations, in weapon racks behind locked doors. Here is my loot guide for Quartz SMG.
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

further_reading.title: Inside Star Citizen on Patrol Missions
Inside Star Citizen | Alpha 4.2: Into the Storm (ISC on Storm Breaker)

Or larger (150k & 300k) blue boxes at Hathor Group Locations.; Grassland Quasi Grazer Egg @ Looted from killed Grassland Quasi Grazer they have roughly 12 each, here is where they can be found: Grassland Quasi Grazer Habitat.; Quartz Energy SMG @ Looted from Align & Mine PAF & OLP locations, in weapon racks behind locked doors. Here is my loot guide for Quartz SMG.
items.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

ships.name: ATLS IKTI
ships.recipe: 1x Argo ATLS; 2x NN-13 Cannon; 5x Irradiated Valakkar Fang (Apex); 2x Wikelo Favour
ships.description: Wikelo Has a mission to turn ATLS into ATLS Ikti, and ATLS Ikti + ATLS GEO into ATLS Ikti GEO both with a Wikelo themed skin, like his ships. Turning in an ATLS or variant thereof to Wikelo doesn't mean you lose access to it.
ships.sources: Argo ATLS, Argo ATLS GEO @ Sold in all ship stores; Wikelo Favour @ 1x Wikelo Favour costs 15x Irradiated Apex Valakkar Pearls / x50 Scrip / x50 Carinite; NN-13 Cannon @ Orbituary Contested Zone, or Wikelo's Golem for 5x Wikelo Favour, 15x ASD Secure Drive; Irradiated Valakkar Pearl @ Apex Irradiated Valakkar, found at Lazarous Complex on Pyro 1 (part of Storm Breaker sandbox); Irradiated Valakkar Fang (Apex) @ Apex Irradiated Valakkar, found at Lazarous Complex on Pyro 1 (part of Storm Breaker sandbox); DCHS-05 Orbital Positioning Comp-Board @ looted from Ghost Arena in Ruin Station
ships.notes: I assume they're not meant to look exactly identical, pretty sure GEO is meant to have the backpack that enables it to jump, but not non-GEO one, the 2 on display at Wikelo's are exactly identical for some reason. There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

ships.sources: Argo ATLS, Argo ATLS GEO @ Sold in all ship stores; Wikelo Favour @ 1x Wikelo Favour costs 15x Irradiated Apex Valakkar Pearls / x50 Scrip / x50 Carinite; NN-13 Cannon @ Orbituary Contested Zone, or Wikelo's Golem for 5x Wikelo Favour, 15x ASD Secure Drive; Irradiated Valakkar Pearl @ Apex Irradiated Valakkar, found at Lazarous Complex on Pyro 1 (part of Storm Breaker sandbox); Irradiated Valakkar Fang (Apex) @ Apex Irradiated Valakkar, found at Lazarous Complex on Pyro 1 (part of Storm Breaker sandbox); DCHS-05 Orbital Positioning Comp-Board @ looted from Ghost Arena in Ruin Station
ships.notes: I assume they're not meant to look exactly identical, pretty sure GEO is meant to have the backpack that enables it to jump, but not non-GEO one, the 2 on display at Wikelo's are exactly identical for some reason. There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in. If one item is missing on the cargo elevator vs what you put there, close the UI and open it again, should fix it.

reputation.description: In 4.5 Wikelo has reputation, you earn reputation from completing certain missions, and 2 missions the Idris (999 Rep), and Military Wolf L-21 (340 Rep) need reputation.

entries.mission_title: Now make Polaris. Short Time Deal.
New Move Big Starlancer Ship (Starlancer TAC)
Zeus Cargo Special (Zeus Mk II CL)
Where Wolf? Here Wolf (L-21 Wolf Stealth)
Most Special Wolf (L-21 Wolf Military + Antium Midnight Sun & Fresnel "Deepwater" Energy LMG)

currency_exchanges.description: You can earn Wikelo Favour in 4.3 by trading Wikelo 12x Irradiated Apex Valakkar Pearls (AA) aquired from Storm Breaker sandbox activity in Pryo. Used to be 10x AAA prior to 4.5
currency_exchanges.notes: Turning in 10+ pearls at the same time doesn't work (to complete more than 1 mission at the same time) you get 1 Wikelo Favour and the extra pearls goes into your inventory. There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box stack the pearls into lots of 15 in the item kiosk, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

further_reading.title: MrKraken's Excellent Storm Breaker One-Page Guide
MrKraken's Storm Breaker Storm Breaker Complete Guide
Inside Star Citizen | Alpha 4.2: Into the Storm (ISC on Storm Breaker)

currency_exchanges.description: You can earn Wikelo Favour in 4.2 by trading Wikelo 40x Carinite aquired from Align and Mine sandbox at Aberdeen / Daymar
currency_exchanges.notes: Turning in 50+ Carinite at the same time doesn't work (to complete more than 1 mission at the same time) you get 1 Wikelo Favour and the extra Carinite goes into your inventory unstacked There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box stack the Carinite into lots of 50 in the item kiosk, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

currency_exchanges.description: You can turn in 50x MG Scrip / Council Scrip for 1x Wikelo Favour which is part of most trades with Wikelo, you get MG Scrip from Hunt the Polaris (in 4.1.1), Foxwell Patrol / Ambush missions, and combat gauntlet missions from Gilly. You get Council Scrip from Headhunters Patrol / Ambush missions.
currency_exchanges.notes: Turning in 50+ scrip at the same time doesn't work (to complete more than 1 mission at the same time) you get 1 Wikelo Favour and the extra scrip goes into your inventory unstacked (which is a pain). There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box stack the scrip into lots of 50 in the item kiosk (or just ship it in the stor*all in stacks of 50), go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send a stack of 50 script up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in.

further_reading.title: Inside Star Citizen on Patrol Missions

very_hungry.notes: There is an item kiosk to the right of the entrance to the emporium proper, lets you move items in and out of local storage more easily than the cargo elevator, though doesn't count towards turn-ins, the way I prefer to turn in items especially in bulk is carry it in a stor*all box, store the box either via the cargo elevator or drag it into the item kiosk, then unload the box, go to the cargo elevator kiosk and send what you're turning in up the cargo elevator, and then down it to turn in (in the proper amounts, not more).
